poem:
**Fraudulent Symphony**

Our phones, pied pipers,
calling out numbers and codes.
Fingers dance on glass,
whispers in circuitry lead to vaults.
Bank accounts, emptied by
ghosts in the machine—
silent heists, digital shadows
pulling strings.
Wallets lighter, trust shattered,
our echoes lost in the binary music.
